subject: History
title: The Antibiotic Resistance Crisis
description: A quick, practical guide to The Antibiotic Resistance Crisis.

hook.text: Alexander Fleming warned in 1945 that bacteria would evolve to resist antibiotics. He was exactly right.

buildup.text: Overuse in medicine and agriculture has accelerated resistance. Bacteria evolve faster than we can develop new drugs.

discovery.text: MRSA, C. difficile, and drug-resistant TB kill over 1.2 million people annuallyâ€”more than HIV or malaria.

twist.text: No major new class of antibiotics has been discovered since the 1980s. The pipeline is nearly empty.

climax.text: Without new antibiotics, routine surgery and cancer treatment could become deadly again. The clock is ticking.

punchline.text: The wonder drugs are losing their wonder.

quiz.question: When was the last major new class of antibiotics discovered?
